question: True or false: the longer you go without a win, the more likely you are to win on the next bet.
answers: True
False
answerExplain: Winning or losing bets in the past has no impact on the probability of winning in the future.

question: Which of the following are healthy beliefs about betting?
answers: You can earn money through betting if you are knowledgeable enough
You’ll eventually win back money you lost if you keep betting
A near miss means that you were close to winning
answerExplain: Sports betting odds are set in a way that sportsbooks make money from bettors no matter who wins. This, combined with the element of chance, makes it hard to win back lost money no matter how skilled or knowledgeable a bettor is. Near misses may be due to chance and do not necessarily mean that you were on the right track.

question: Which of the following are bad reasons for betting on sports?
answers: To have fun
To improve your mood
To compete with others
To pay bills
answerExplain: Only gamble to have fun or entertain yourself. Gambling to pay bills, earn money, challenge other people, or relieve negative feelings are all unhealthy reasons for betting that are correlated with gambling problems.

question: To safely take advantage of a betting promotion, which of the following should you do?
answers: Read the fine print carefully
Stop betting when the promotion no longer applies
Take advantage of the offer by betting more money
Sign up for multiple betting platforms so you can take advantage of more offers
answerExplain: Betting offers may have unexpected conditions, so be sure to read the fine print carefully. Promotions often appear to reduce the risk of losing while enhancing the reward for winning but are designed to encourage you to bet more and spend more. If you didn’t plan to, don’t continue betting once the offer no longer applies.

question: Why is it hard to earn money from sports betting?
answers: People are not knowledgeable enough to win
A significant number of sports games are rigged
The sportsbook takes a cut of every bet
People are too confident when they are winning
answerExplain: Earning more money than you lose is hard because sportsbook takes a cut of every bet, which is called the “juice” or “vig.” For example, if the odds are -110 on both sides, two bettors pay $110 in opposing bets, but the sportsbook takes $10 and the winner is only paid $210 rather than $220.

question: Which of the following are responsible betting strategies?
answers: Stop betting if you’re not having fun
Bet while on alcohol or drugs
Bet more money when you’ve been winning
Set a limit on how often you bet and how much time you play for

question: Which of the following are responsible betting strategies?
answers: Don’t bet when you’re upset
Set a budget and stick to it
Take frequent breaks
Bet on the spur of the moment when the odds are good
answerExplain: Placing bets when you’re upset, in the heat of the moment, or immersed in the activity for longe periods of time can cause you to make impulsive decisions with your money. Be sure to take frequent breaks and stick to your budget.

question: What is the best way to avoid losing more money on bets than you can afford to lose?
answers: Cash out losing bets early and bet on something else
Only stop betting when you’ve broken even
Stop betting once you’ve spent what you had planned to spend
Use your winnings to place more bets
answerExplain: The best way to avoid losing more money than you can afford to lose is to stop betting once you’ve spent the amount of money you budgeted for betting, even if you’ve lost that money. Options to “cash-out” losing bets and reuse winnings to place more bets are correlated with gambling problems because they encourage bettors to continue betting. Recouping lost money by placing more bets is difficult because odds are designed so that the sportsbook makes money from bettors.

question: True or false: if you always bet on the heavy favourite, you’ll gain money over the long term.
answers: True
False
answerExplain: There is always a chance that the heavy favourite could lose. Sportsbooks set odds for favourites so that you must risk a lot of money for a small reward. The money you forfeit by losing a few times will exceed what you gain by winning many times.

question: All legal Ontario sportsbooks are required to provide the following…
answers: Time and money limiting tools
Self-exclusion, a self-imposed platform ban
Information about your betting activity
Free counselling services
answerExplain: All Ontario sportsbooks are required to provide bettors with the ability to set time and money limiting controls, betting account information, and the option to self-exclude. By self-excluding, bettors can ban themselves from a betting platform and opt out of betting-related marketing. In the future, Ontario iGaming is planning to implement a province-wide self-exclusion program that applies to all sportsbooks.

question: Which of the following are unhealthy gambling behaviours?
answers: Using rent or grocery money for betting
Betting on long shots and underdogs
Borrowing money or selling things to bet
Watching sporting events to see how your bets fare

question: Which of the following could be signs of harmful betting?
answers: You rarely win at betting
You find it difficult to stop betting
You feel that you must hide your betting from others
You feel worse when you’re not  betting

question: Which of the following could be signs of harmful betting?
answers: Betting small amounts of money is boring
Betting gets in the way of work or family obligations
Betting takes up most of your leisure time
Betting is more exciting than other leisure activities
answerExplain: Rarely winning when you bet on sports is not a sign of harmful gambling. Betting platforms are designed so that you lose money. Want to check in on your gambling habits?

question: Which of the following are healthy mindsets to have when trying to cut down on your betting?
answers: If I lost this money, I would feel…
If I didn’t bet, I could spend the money on…
Others might think badly of me if they knew about my betting
I can prove to myself that I don’t have a gambling problem
answerExplain: The stigma and shame of having a gambling problem can prevent gamblers from seeking help. If you’re trying to cut down on betting, think instead about what it took to earn the money you would use for gambling, how you would feel if you lost it all for nothing, and what you could spend it on instead.

question: Which of the following are good solutions if you think you have a gambling problem?
answers: Talk to a counsellor, support group, or someone you trust
Limit your access to money for gambling
Block gambling platforms
Call an addictions helpline
Deal with the problem on your own

question: If you are a responsible bettor, which of the following steps are optional?
answers: Going to counselling
Using platform controls such as money and time limits
Setting a budget
Understanding the type of bet you’re placing

question: To lower your risk of gambling-related harms, gamble no more than __ % of your household income per month.
answerExplain: Responsible Gambling Council’s guidelines recommend gambling no more than 1% of your household income per month if you choose to gamble.

question: To lower your risk of gambling-related harms, gamble no more than __ day(s) per month
answers: 1 day
4 days
8 days
15 days
answerExplain: Responsible Gambling Council’s guidelines recommend gambling no more than 4 days a month or once a week if you choose to gamble.

question: Which of the following statements about betting harms are true?
answers: If betting is not affecting your financial health, it's not harmful
If you don’t bet often, it won't be harmful
If you’re knowledgeable about how betting works, you won't experience betting-related harms
answerExplain: Gambling can be harmful to area of your life other than your finances even if you are knowledgeable about gambling and don’t do it often.

question: True or false: older people are at higher risk of  betting-related harms
answers: True
False
answerExplain: Younger bettors are at higher risk of gambling problems due to lack of experience and knowledge of responsible gambling beliefs and practices. Other risk factors include being male, single, and Asian.
